name: General Risk Propensity Scale
description: An 8-item measure of general risk propensity assessing individuals' tendency to take risks across different life domains. Provides a domain-general measure of risk-taking tendency.
reference: Zhang, D. C., Highhouse, S., & Nye, C. D. (2019). Development and validation of the General Risk Propensity Scale (GRiPS). Journal of Behavioral Decision Making, 32(2), 152-167.
instructions: Please indicate how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.

questions.name: grips_1
questions.description: Taking risks makes life more fun.

questions.name: grips_2
questions.description: My friends would say that I'm a risk taker.

questions.name: grips_3
questions.description: I enjoy taking risks in most aspects of my life.

questions.name: grips_4
questions.description: I would take a risk even if it meant I might get hurt.

questions.name: grips_5
questions.description: Taking risks is an important part of my life.

questions.name: grips_7
questions.description: I am a believer in taking chances.
